adjective.description: Clad in, protected by, or covered with armour; specifically (of a warship) covered wholly or partly with thick defensive metal plates.
Of an animal, or a part of its body: having the surface protected by a defensive outer layer of scales, bones, plates, etc.

noun.description: An armour-clad warship. Compare "ironclad". Now historical.

origin: Mid 18th century; earliest use found in Samuel Bentley (1722–1803). From armour + clad.
